title: Michigan unresolved tickets (Michigan Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requests and responses to any 911 and 912 tickets related to the Bridges eligibility system that remained unresolved for a period of more than 10 days between Jan. 1, 2023 and the date of production of this records request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samantha Liss

title: Michigan unresolved tickets (Michigan Department of Technology, Management, and Budget)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

correspondence between Kennith Wingard and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2022, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where Kennith Wingard is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

All correspondence to and from 1SG Marshall W Hancock from January 1, 2022 to the present that include any of the following keywords: "housing", "TDY", “Warfighter", "furniture", "lodging" "per diem" "DMC", "C2", "Kennith", Ken", "Clark", "KW", "CM”, “WF”
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please include any correspondence where Marshall W Hancock is either the sender or recipient, and the specified keywords appear in the subject line, body, or attachments of the communications.

This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

title: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman,  SWAT TEAM SUSPENSIONS

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: McLennan County Administrator Dustin Chapman,  SWAT TEAM SUSPENSIONS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Members of the MCSO SWAT team that have been suspended from SWAT in the past six months and what their suspension was for and any disciplinary paperwork associated with those suspensions . Also any questionaires that have been issued out in reference to those suspensions and who wrote the questionaires and the questionaire's that have been turned back in reference to any and all suspensions from the SWAT TEAM

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bernadette Feazell
